Omek::ISensor Class Reference

The ISensor class serves as both an interface to a connected 3D depth sensor, as well as a virtual camera simulating a real camera by using a specified sequence. More...

Detailed Description

The ISensor class serves as both an interface to a connected 3D depth sensor, as well as a virtual camera simulating a real camera by using a specified sequence.

Member Function Documentation

virtual const char* Omek::ISensor::getCameraName ( bool  bShortName = true) const [pure virtual]
Parameters:
[in]bShortName"true" (default) will return the short (single word) version, while "false" returns the full name
Returns:
the name of the current camera
virtual OMKStatus Omek::ISensor::getCameraParameter ( const char *  name,
int &  value 
) const [pure virtual]

Get specific sensor parameters.

Parameters:
[in]namecan be one of the following values, depending on specific sensor:
"flipped" - 1 if raw data input is flipped horizontally (mirror), 0 otherwise
"enableRGB" - 1 sensor is grabbing RGB/IR, 0 otherwise
"frequency" - get the operating frequency of the sensor, if supported
"serial" - get the serial number for connected sensor, if supported
[out]valuethe return value for the requested parameter
Returns:
OMK_SUCCESS for success, an error code otherwise

virtual bool Omek::ISensor::goToFramenum ( unsigned long  frameNum) [pure virtual]

Set the current frame number.

Parameters:
[in]frameNumthe new frame-number to go to
Returns:
true if a valid frame was entered, and the sequence was advanced successfully
virtual bool Omek::ISensor::isAlive ( ) const [pure virtual]

In sequence mode this will return false when reached the end of the sequence/or when there are no more frames to show In camera mode this will return true unless an error occurred, or the camera was not connected.

Returns:
true if more frames are available, false otherwise
virtual OMKStatus Omek::ISensor::setCameraParameter ( const char *  name,
int  value 
) [pure virtual]

Set specific sensor parameters.

Parameters:
[in]namecan be one of the following values, depending on specific sensor:
"flipped" - set to 1 to flip raw data input horizontally (mirror), 0 for default
"enableRGB" - set to 1 to grab RGB or IR data (depending on camera), or 0 to grab depth only
"matchRGB" - set to 1 for a 1-to-1 pixel match of RGB and depth data, or 0 to disable. This is typically a CPU heavy operation, and thus it is turned off by default.
"outDepthRes" - set to higher depth resolutions IMAGE_RESOLUTION_QQVGA, IMAGE_RESOLUTION_QVGA, or IMAGE_RESOLUTION_VGA
"outImageRes" - set to higher RGB resolutions IMAGE_RESOLUTION_QQVGA, IMAGE_RESOLUTION_QVGA, or IMAGE_RESOLUTION_VGA
"frequency" - change the operating frequency of the sensor (if supported by sensor)
[in]valuethe new value to set parameter to
Returns:
OMK_SUCCESS for success, an error code otherwise
